repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
improve our completion experiences unbloack after #24723 merge

- move to completion module and rewrite
- add new api `vim.lsp.auto_complete` for auto completion usage
  `on_attach = function(client,bufnr) vim.lsp.auto_complete(client, bufnr, fuzzy_match)`


https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/41671631/94820aac-ea91-4a71-8d3f-122d5a9525ef



Fix #25177  (same  https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/17051, https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/22803)

comment_data.body: We want to get rid of `vim.lsp.util` completely, not dump more stuff in there...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2223,6 +2112,18 @@ function M.make_formatting_params(options)
   }
 end
 
+--- Returns the buffer number for the given {bufnr}.
+---
+---@param bufnr (integer|nil) Buffer number to resolve. Defaults to current buffer
+---@return integer bufnr
+function M.resolve_bufnr(bufnr)
+  vim.validate({ bufnr = { bufnr, 'n', true } })
+  if bufnr == nil or bufnr == 0 then
+    return api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+  end
+  return bufnr
+end
+

comment_data.body: This includes _not_ adding any autocompletion (yet). Please keep _this_ PR to a pure refactor, and then make a separate `feat` PR for the autocompletion afterwards (which I'm not 100% certain we want, personally, but it's @mfussenegger's call).

comment_data.body:
This complies with lsp's specifications. lsp clarifies the specification of auto-completion, which is also provided by many editors. Similarly, this is just basic lsp auto-completion, and the entire completion module is less than 300 lines. 90% of people are using autocomplete. I want to know if you know about lsp and implementation. 

Comparing all the omnifunc codes in master,  they are `~=` :) At least it's pure in terms of completion. And all the refactorings are designed for omnifunc and auto_complete

comment_data.body:
The interface is `vim.lsp.omnifunc`, so this new "completion" module should stay private.
```suggestion
  omnifunc = require('vim.lsp._completion').omnifunc,
```

   codelens = require('vim.lsp.codelens'),
   semantic_tokens = semantic_tokens,
   util = util,
+  omnifunc = require('vim.lsp.completion').omnifunc,

comment_data.body:
You misunderstand me. My point is that autocomplete is a "feature" that does not belong in _this_ PR, which is marked "refactor". Please open a separate PR for it.

And I do know about LSP and the specification (which mentions "autocomplet*" nowhere).

comment_regular_data.body: could we move `omnifunc` to a single file ï¼ŸIncreasing function parameters sideways is a bit ugly. Avoid lsp.lua becoming bloated

> could we move omnifunc to a single file ï¼ŸIncreasing function parameters sideways is a bit ugly.

I don't understand this.

> Avoid lsp.lua becoming bloated

Spreading things around in more files cause a different problem. What is "bloated" about a single omnifunc() function in lsp.lua?

If something is bloated, code should be deleted. Spreading it out just hides the problem.

The implementation of filter text and start_col on the previous code will involve file crossing. And it doesn't make sense to put some functions in util i think.  now I add `completion.lua` for `omnifunc` and support `filterText` with fuzzymatch.
test case write later . I would like to know the opinion of other members regarding the current implementation first

> Spreading things around in more files cause a different problem. What is "bloated" about a since omnifunc() function in lsp.lua?
> If something is bloated, code should be deleted. Spreading it out just hides the problem.


I think a lsp/completion.lua would be okayish if we use it to eliminate the existing spread. Instead of:

- lsp.lua
    - omnifunc
- lsp/util.lua
    - extract_completion_items
    - text_document_completion_list_to_complete_items

We could have:

- lsp/completion.lua
    - omnifunc
    - _private_ /local extract_completion_items and text_document_completion_list_to_complete_items
    - future: turn omnifunc sync, add show() for async completion; this could also supports option to e.g. filter candidates to only show snippets
    - future: Add a way to setup CompleteDone event to handle additionalTextEdits + snippets
I am plan to add `vim.lsp.autocompletion` and async document preview ,  need wait #24723 . after #24273 done i will back to this pr.

> private /local extract_completion_items and text_document_completion_list_to_complete_items

wouldn't it make sense to expose those functions somehow so people can use them for e.g. completion plugins?
item needs to pass the filter and fuzzy match check before it will be added to complete. The logic here doesn't apply to plugins. Note that this is an early draft only.

> I am plan to add vim.lsp.autocompletion

Please don't use `autocompletion` but `completion`. Automatic trigger should (if at all) just be one aspect of the functionality, not the main focus.

I mean vim.lsp.autocompletion can be used in on attach if someone need just a simple completion for lsp and word. there will be no changes to the omnifunc it will still exist. does not break the current behavior.  Just to add an ancillary. Because it's easy to implement and doesn't require too much code .  This is just a thought on my part.

> Because it's easy to implement and doesn't require too much code

That's not a sufficient reason to add LSP-specific autocompletion. What is the Problem/Solution description? Why can't existing autocomplete plugins use `vim.lsp.omnifunc` ?

Auto-completion is something we should eventually add to Nvim ([mini-complete](https://github.com/echasnovski/mini.completion) has been working very well for me...), but not in a LSP-specific way.

Because it's small enough. Good enough to use. Most people need it. This is the reason if you want something simple. This is enough. Why install an extra plugin? Better give it a try.  If it is not accepted I will give up this PR because I think it is something worthwhile.

> Because it's small enough. Good enough to use. Most people need it. This is the reason if you want something simple

_Generalized_ autocompletion is on the roadmap. If we add special-case autocompletion, that's extra surface-area that must later be deprecated.

> If it is not accepted I will give up this PR because I think it is something worthwhile.

The refactoring/cleanup part of the PR could still be worthwhile, but adding special-case autocompletion is not in scope for the reasons I mentioned.

If the code is easy and small, it could be added as an example at `:help compl-autocomplete`

> Generalized autocompletion is on the roadmap. If we add special-case autocompletion, that's extra surface-area that must later be deprecated.

Obviously I thought about these issues. That's why I controlled it to < 200 lines (- code of ominfunc)  and that's why I said it's small enough. And there's nothing to add here. other things can do in plugin or locally.

> That's why I controlled it to < 200 lines (- code of ominfunc)

Code size is only part of the cost calculation. Over time, having many special-case features is a maintenance burden. Since 2014 we have always strived to find ways to generalize mechanisms instead of adding special-case features. It doesn't matter that this particular case in isolation looks small.

I understand what you mean. So I say there is nothing to add here. it only provides basic lsp completion. If anyone wants more it's entirely possible to do it locally and then work together. This is separate.

Something interesting about this PR is `completionProvider.triggerCharacters`. That should be called out in the Problem/Solution description (which says WHY a change is needed). Reviewers should not need to do detective work to figure out why a PR is needed.

Do we need a 'completetrigger' option? That is the kind of [generalized mechanism](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/917#issuecomment-48127449) we are looking for.  cc @echasnovski 

What is needed from Nvim core so that [:help compl-autocomplete](https://neovim.io/doc/user/insert.html#compl-autocomplete) could "just work" with `vim.lsp.omnifunc()`?

> Do we need a 'completetrigger' option? That is the kind of [generalized mechanism](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/917#issuecomment-48127449) we are looking for. cc @echasnovski
> 
> What is needed from Nvim core so that [:help compl-autocomplete](https://neovim.io/doc/user/insert.html#compl-autocomplete) could "just work" with `vim.lsp.omnifunc()`?

After reading comments here, I am not sure what are talking points here.

When it comes to auto-completion, my main struggles implementing 'mini.completion' (as far as I remember) were at least these ones:
- Finding a good way to automatically start timer to later trigger showing completion. The best approach was to use `InsertCharPre` event, but I vaguely remember it having annoying downsides. For example, the text is not up to date as it is *before* inserting character, not after. There are also some notes in code about it being not enough to track any manual text change (it is not triggered after `<CR>`). So `InsertCharPost` might be helpful here.
- Creating a custom completion dialog with `vim.fn.complete()` was problematic because it disappears after `<BS>`. So I had to resort to using more native `omnifunc`/`completefunc` and emulate them with `vim.api.nvim_feedkeys()`.

I am not sure about adding adding a 'completetrigger' option as in "pattern for character after which to trigger completion". I can't really put my finger on why, maybe because it feels too not future proof in case of some complicated async autocompletion would emerge.

@echasnovski thank you! Created https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/25670 to track some ideas.

> I am not sure about adding adding a 'completetrigger' option as in "pattern for character after which to trigger completion".

Understandable. Just trying to discover what the key missing pieces needed

> feels too not future proof in case of some complicated async autocompletion would emerge.

What if it were a function that "resolved" the trigger chars on-demand?

> What if it were a function that "resolved" the trigger chars on-demand?

I am not sure I understand what "resolved" here would mean.

Broadly speaking, for a working decently generalizable and user-friendly auto-completion functionality in core, there should be:
- Generalizable and user-friendly way to automatically start the completion. This can be as straightforward as a callback that is called on every user input. Inside it should take care of deciding whether to start completion (now or later) and actually starting it.
- Generalizable and user-friendly way to display completion items. There is a `complete()`, but it has downsides described earlier. So a built-in 'completefunc' approach is the only option right with the balance of being usable without too much complications. Also, custom matching would be a welcome addition. I vaguely remember some work in vim/vim for this, but not sure the status of it.

if anyone want fix https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/25177  https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/17051, https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/22803  check how i get start col current is wrong before also wrong . `filtertext` should not used in there.
